questions.question: What is the role of the activation function in a neural network?
options: Determining the output of each neuron
Connecting different layers of the network
Training the network using backpropagation
Initializing the weights of the network
questions.correct_answer: Determining the output of each neuron

questions.question: Which of the following machine learning models is primarily used for time series prediction?
options: Convolutional Neural Networks
Random Forest
Recurrent Neural Networks
Support Vector Machines

questions.question: What is the purpose of the hidden layers in a deep neural network?
options: To interact with the input data directly
To make the network deeper
To output the final prediction
To learn complex patterns from the input data
questions.correct_answer: To learn complex patterns from the input data

questions.question: In reinforcement learning, what is the 'exploration vs exploitation' trade-off?
options: Balancing the learning rate with the discount factor
Choosing between learning new knowledge and using existing knowledge to make decisions
Deciding when to update the policy and the value function
Balancing the size of the network with its computational complexity
questions.correct_answer: Choosing between learning new knowledge and using existing knowledge to make decisions

questions.question: What is the primary function of the 'loss function' in a machine learning algorithm?
options: To measure the accuracy of the model's predictions
To update the weights and biases in the model
To prevent the model from overfitting
To calculate the distance between the model's predictions and the true values
questions.correct_answer: To calculate the distance between the model's predictions and the true values

questions.question: In the context of machine learning, what does 'bias' refer to?
options: The amount of error introduced by approximating a real-world problem
The tendency of a model to consistently learn the same wrong thing
The model's ability to maximise reward in reinforcement learning
The difference between the average prediction of the model and the correct value
questions.correct_answer: The tendency of a model to consistently learn the same wrong thing

questions.question: What is the purpose of a 'validation set' in machine learning?
options: To train the model
To test the model after training
To provide an unbiased evaluation of a model fit on the training dataset while tuning model hyperparameters
To adjust the weights of the model during backpropagation
questions.correct_answer: To provide an unbiased evaluation of a model fit on the training dataset while tuning model hyperparameters

questions.question: In the context of AI, what is 'transfer learning'?
options: A technique where a pre-trained model is used on a new, similar problem
Transferring knowledge from one machine learning model to another
A technique to ensure that the AI can understand human transfer of information
The process of updating the weights in a neural network during backpropagation
questions.correct_answer: A technique where a pre-trained model is used on a new, similar problem

questions.question: Which of the following is a widely used method for dimensionality reduction?
options: Principal Component Analysis (PCA)
Hyperparameter tuning
Cost function minimization
Transfer learning

questions.question: In the context of natural language processing, what is 'sentiment analysis'?
options: Analyzing the structure of sentences
Analyzing the meaning of words
Determining the mood or subjective opinions within large amounts of text
Translating text from one language to another
questions.correct_answer: Determining the mood or subjective opinions within large amounts of text
